tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE recipe_comments (
    comment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT REFERENCES user_profiles(user_id),
    recipe_id INT,
    comment_text TEXT,
    date_posted TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE RecipeComments (
  comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  recipe_id INT,
  comment TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES UserProfiles(user_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES Recipes(recipe_id)
);

CREATE TABLE PopularRecipeTrends (
  trend_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_id INT,
  trend_type VARCHAR(50),
  trend_score INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES Recipes(recipe_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_profiles ( 
 user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
 username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
 email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, 
 age INT, 
 date_registered DATE 
);

CREATE TABLE recipe_comments ( 
 comment_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
 user_id INT NOT NULL, 
 recipe_id INT NOT NULL, 
 comment_text TEXT, 
 date_posted TIMESTAMP 
);

CREATE TABLE popular_recipes ( 
 recipe_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
 recipe_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL, 
 category VARCHAR(50), 
 rating DECIMAL(3,2), 
 date_posted DATE, 
 views INT 
);

CREATE TABLE recipe_trends ( 
 trend_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
 recipe_id INT NOT NULL, 
 trend_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, 
 trend_score INT, 
 trend_date DATE 
);

CREATE TABLE UserProfiles (
  user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(100),
  join_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE RecipeComments (
  comment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INT,
  recipe_id INT,
  comment_text TEXT,
  comment_date DATETIME
)

CREATE TABLE PopularRecipes (
  recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_name VARCHAR(100),
  recipe_description TEXT,
  likes_count INT
)

CREATE TABLE UserFavorites (
  user_id INT,
  recipe_id INT,
  PRIMARY KEY (user_id, recipe_id)
)

CREATE TABLE RecipeTags (
  tag_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_id INT,
  tag_name VARCHAR(50)
)
